channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Three new cases in Waikato connected to remand prisoner
item.description: Three household members of a remand prisoner with Covid-19 have tested positive for the virus, Ministry of Health says.

item.title: Dropping childhood immunisation rates leave children vulnerable, new research says
item.description: Immunisation levels are the lowest they have been in decades, according to new research, and experts are calling for an overhaul of the system.

item.title: Covid-19 briefing: 'Delta's tail is long and it is tough' - PM
item.description: As Auckland waits to hear if it will move down an alert level this week, the prime minister assured the country the level four lockdown is working, even with a small rise in cases the past two days.

item.title: Weekly cheer: Takeaway life hacks and cute critters as Auckland anticipates level 3
item.description: As Aucklanders anxiously anticipate a drop in lockdown levels, it's time for a few cheerful distractions as we wait for the next announcement.

item.title: Covid-19 update: 24 new community cases reported in NZ
item.description: There have been 24 new community cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand today, including a case in Auckland's Mount Eden prison.

item.title: Cutting through the back paddock - 'isolated' border breach attempts
item.description: Homemade exemption passes and shortcuts through paddocks are among the attempted lockdown breaches reported by police this week.

item.title: Search continues for Thomas Phillips and children; base to be stood down
item.description: The search base at Marokopa beach to look for Thomas Phillips and his children will be stood down today, but police say their work is far from over.

item.title: Government announces $36m investment in Covid-19 research fund
item.description: The government will invest $36m into infectious disease research to aid with the Covid-19 pandemic response and prepare for future infectious disease outbreaks.

item.title: Auckland couple flies to Wellington in latest lockdown breach
item.description: Two people snapped flouting alert level four restrictions by travelling from Auckland to Wellington have tested negative for Covid-19.

item.title: Police targeting gangs and guns: 'The trick is to be as surgical as possible'
item.description: A police operation aimed at getting guns out of the hands of organised criminals and gangs is quite rightly being extended, according to an expert on criminal behaviour.

item.title: Person dies after driving at high speed and hitting power poles
item.description: A person has died after a car crashed in the early hours in Mount Roskill, Auckland.

item.title: Timaru tragedy: Woman charged with murder of three daughters appears in court
item.description: The woman charged with the murder of her three daughters in their Timaru home on Thursday night has appeared in court this morning.

item.title: Covid-19: Couple caught out in Taupo, Aucklanders flock to beaches
item.description: A couple has been arrested for using false information to pass the southern TÄmaki Makaurau border to stay in Taupo, and a group was caught fishing in Mission Bay.

item.title: Covid-19: Get vaccinated to help avoid level 4 again - Health Minister
item.description: Level four lockdowns could become a thing of the past if Covid-19 vaccination rates are high enough, the health minister has signalled.

item.title: Search continues for missing father and children
item.description: Family and friends scoured the rugged King Country coastline today at Marokopa and Kiritehere beaches today, but still had no luck finding Thomas Phillips and his children, or any items of interest.

item.title: Covid-19 update: 20 new community cases in New Zealand today
item.description: The number of new community cases of Covid-19 has jumped after several days of falling numbers, with 20 new cases reported in Auckland today.

item.title: Body found at Foxton Beach
item.description: A body was found at Foxton Beach at about midday today.

item.title: Lockdowns push families and migrants to the edge - advocates
item.description: Lockdowns and restrictions have pushed some families and groups to the bone financially, and the government needs to offer better support, social support groups say.
